alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 11 at 1:15AM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet, with occasional sets 8 to 10 feet. Highest surf in southern San Diego County. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Beaches of San Diego County and Orange County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, through 6 PM today. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 4 AM to noon today. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying beach parking lots, boardwalks, and roads with isolated road closures. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide of around 6.7 feet is predicted this morning at around 810 AM PST. Coastal flooding is most likely within a few hours before or after high tide.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
